definition: variant of 比劃|比划[bi3 hua5]
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

sentences.english: What are you gesturing about with him?
sentences.chinese: 大牛，你们俩还在比画什么呢？

sentences.english: The true life have to gesticulate up vivid many.
sentences.chinese: 真人生得比画上可生动了许多。

sentences.english: Annie had to read all the books for Helen and trace the words into her hand.
sentences.chinese: 安妮得为她阅读所有的书籍，并在她手里比画单词。

sentences.english: She, have more wine friend than the artist.
sentences.chinese: 她，是一个酒友比画友多的艺术家。

sentences.english: Your words leaved are beautiful more than a picture or just words.
sentences.chinese: 你的留言比画或者纯粹的文字都漂亮。

sentences.english: The policeman gestured for us to stop.
sentences.chinese: 警察比画着叫我们停下来。

sentences.english: The English teacher likes making gestures when he is teaching.
sentences.chinese: 英语老师讲课时爱比画。

definition: to gesture/to gesticulate/to practice the moves of a martial art by imitating the teacher/to fight/to come to blows
full details/full particulars
to look over carefully/to scrutinize
to sweep/to brush away
to wave/to brandish
to make eyes/to wink
to pull/to stretch/to draw sth out
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
finger/toe/CL:個|个[ge4]
to put one's hands on one's hips
to move back and forth/to fiddle with
to mumble/to mutter to oneself
variant of 念念有詞|念念有词[nian4 nian4 you3 ci2]
fingertip/finger
to wave sth/to brandish
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to select
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
to move to and fro (with hand, foot, stick etc)/to fiddle with/to stir up
